intro: Randia ngoyensis, commonly known as the Ngoye randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Randia ngoyensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and riverine habitats.
